seg-source.mrk: create=true attribute

target.mrk: create=true attribute

seg-source.mrk: create=true database connection URL attribute

target.mrk: create=true database connection URL attribute

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Creates the standard database specified within the database connection URL system and then connects to it. If the database cannot be created, the error appears in the error log and the connection attempt fails with an SQLException indicating that the database cannot be found.

seg-source.mrk: Creates the standard database specified within the database connection URL <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system and then connects to it.
If the database cannot be created, the error appears in the error log and the connection attempt fails with an SQLException indicating that the database cannot be found.

target.mrk: Creates the standard database specified within the database connection URL <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system and then connects to it.
If the database cannot be created, the error appears in the error log and the connection attempt fails with an SQLException indicating that the database cannot be found.

trans-unit.source: If the database already exists, creates a connection to the existing database and an SQLWarning is issued.

seg-source.mrk: If the database already exists, creates a connection to the existing database and an SQLWarning is issued.

target.mrk: If the database already exists, creates a connection to the existing database and an SQLWarning is issued.

trans-unit.source: JDBC does not remove the database on failure to connect at create time if failure occurs after the database call occurs. If a database connection URL used create=true and the connection fails to be created, check for the database directory. If it exists, remove it and its contents before the next attempt to create the database.

seg-source.mrk: JDBC does not remove the database on failure to connect at create time if failure occurs after the database call occurs.
If a database connection URL used create=true and the connection fails to be created, check for the database directory.
If it exists, remove it and its contents before the next attempt to create the database.

target.mrk: JDBC does not remove the database on failure to connect at create time if failure occurs after the database call occurs.
If a database connection URL used create=true and the connection fails to be created, check for the database directory.
If it exists, remove it and its contents before the next attempt to create the database.

seg-source.mrk: Database owner

target.mrk: Database owner

trans-unit.source: When the database is created, the current authorization identifier becomes the database owner (see the ). If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled (see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the ), only the database owner can shut down or drop the database, encrypt it, reencrypt it with a new boot password or new encryption key, or perform a full upgrade. If authentication is not enabled, and no user is supplied, the database owner defaults to "APP", which is also the name of the default schema (see ).

seg-source.mrk: When the database is created, the current authorization identifier becomes the database owner (see the ).

If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled (see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>), only the database owner can <xref href="rrefattrib16471.dita#rrefattrib16471">shut down</xref> or <xref href="rrefattribdrop.dita#rrefattribdrop">drop</xref> the database, <xref href="rrefattrib15290.dita#rrefattrib15290">encrypt</xref> it, reencrypt it with a new <xref href="rrefattribnewbootpw.dita#rrefattribnewbootpw">boot password</xref> or new <xref href="rrefattribnewencryptkey.dita#rrefattribnewencryptkey">encryption key</xref>, or perform a full upgrade.

If authentication is not enabled, and no user is supplied, the database owner defaults to "APP", which is also the name of the default schema (see <xref href="rrefsqlj32268.dita#rrefsqlj32268"></xref>).

target.mrk: When the database is created, the current authorization identifier becomes the database owner (see the ).

If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled (see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>), only the database owner can <xref href="rrefattrib16471.dita#rrefattrib16471">shut down</xref> or <xref href="rrefattribdrop.dita#rrefattribdrop">drop</xref> the database, <xref href="rrefattrib15290.dita#rrefattrib15290">encrypt</xref> it, reencrypt it with a new <xref href="rrefattribnewbootpw.dita#rrefattribnewbootpw">boot password</xref> or new <xref href="rrefattribnewencryptkey.dita#rrefattribnewencryptkey">encryption key</xref>, or perform a full upgrade.

If authentication is not enabled, and no user is supplied, the database owner defaults to "APP", which is also the name of the default schema (see <xref href="rrefsqlj32268.dita#rrefsqlj32268"></xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Combining with other attributes

target.mrk: Combining with other attributes

trans-unit.source: You must specify a databaseName (after the subprotocol or subsubprotocol in the database connection URL) or a databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute with this attribute.

seg-source.mrk: You must specify a databaseName (after the subprotocol or subsubprotocol in the database connection URL) or a databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute with this attribute.

target.mrk: You must specify a databaseName (after the subprotocol or subsubprotocol in the database connection URL) or a databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute with this attribute.

trans-unit.source: You can combine this attribute with other attributes. To specify a locale when creating a database, use the territory=ll_CC attribute.

seg-source.mrk: You can combine this attribute with other attributes.
To specify a locale when creating a database, use the territory=ll_CC attribute.

target.mrk: You can combine this attribute with other attributes.
To specify a locale when creating a database, use the territory=ll_CC attribute.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

seg-source.mrk: Creating a file system database:

target.mrk: Creating a file system database:

trans-unit.source: -- create a file system database jdbc:derby:sampleDB;create=true -- create a file system database using the databaseName attribute jdbc:derby:;databaseName=newDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the embedded driver jdbc:derby:memory:myInMemDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the databaseName attribute jdbc:derby:;databaseName=memory:myInMemDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the Network Server jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/memory:myInMemDB;create=true

seg-source.mrk: -- create a file system database jdbc:derby:sampleDB;create=true -- create a file system database using the databaseName attribute jdbc:derby:;databaseName=newDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the embedded driver jdbc:derby:memory:myInMemDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the databaseName attribute jdbc:derby:;databaseName=memory:myInMemDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the Network Server jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/memory:myInMemDB;create=true

target.mrk: -- create a file system database jdbc:derby:sampleDB;create=true -- create a file system database using the databaseName attribute jdbc:derby:;databaseName=newDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the embedded driver jdbc:derby:memory:myInMemDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the databaseName attribute jdbc:derby:;databaseName=memory:myInMemDB;create=true -- create an in-memory database using the Network Server jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/memory:myInMemDB;create=true

trans-unit.source: See "Using in-memory databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/> for information on creating in-memory databases.

seg-source.mrk: See "Using in-memory databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/> for information on creating in-memory databases.

target.mrk: See "Using in-memory databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/> for information on creating in-memory databases.
